subject: Creativity
title: The Music Industry: From Vinyl to Streaming Billions
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Music Industry: From Vinyl to Streaming Billions.

hook.text: In 1999, the music industry earned $23 billion from CDs. By 2014, revenue had halved. Then streaming arrived.

buildup.text: Spotify launched in 2008 with a radical bet: people would pay monthly for access instead of owning albums.

discovery.text: By 2023, streaming generated $17 billion globally, reviving an industry that piracy nearly destroyed.

twist.text: Artists earn fractions of a cent per stream. Most revenue still flows to labels, not creators.

climax.text: Independent artists now use social media to build audiences and bypass labels entirely.

punchline.text: The music business survived. The business model flipped.

quiz.question: What nearly destroyed the music industry before streaming?
